title: Executive Order 5166-Reserving Certain Described Lands for Resurvey, California
content: Under authority contained in the act of June 25, 1910 (36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (37 Stat. 497), and subject to the conditions, provisions and limitations of said acts, it is hereby ordered that the public lands in T. 13 N., Rs. 16 and 17 E., M.D.M., California, be and the same are hereby withdrawn from settlement, location, sale, entry and all forms of appropriation, pending a resurvey of said townships under the act of March 3, 1909 (35 Stat. 845).
This order shall continue in full force and effect unless and until revoked by the President, or by an act of Congress.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5166-Reserving Certain Described Lands for Resurvey, California Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360865
